column4: I try to upgrade to 7.04, and it tells me to free 117 megs on /usr--but I have over a gig free
how do I make it believe I have enough free space on /usr to upgrade?
Can I find out why update-manager doesn't think I have enough free space when I totally, like, do?
run 'df -h' in a terminal and paste the result to pastebin
